numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Some students have the same test scores.
2. An elite college must decide which student to admit.
3. A legacy applicant has a better chance of admission than a non-legacy applicant who has the same test score.
4. Some non-legacy applicants come from poorer families.
5. Some non-legacy applicants come from wealthy families.
6. A non-legacy applicant from a poorer family has a higher chance of admission than a wealthy non-legacy applicant.
7. I wonder why colleges pay more attention to a student's background and income than to a student's test scores.
8. A non-legacy student can have a higher test score than a legacy student.
9. I wonder if a higher test score would convince a college to admit the non-legacy student instead of the legacy student.
10. I am currently in high school.
11. Next year I will start preparing for college.
12. I may be a non-legacy student.
13. I may be not a poor non-legacy student.
14. I can get good test scores.
15. I wonder if I will have a good chance of admission.
16. The headline is: Dear my future college, am I good enough for you?
